en: The corkscrew was invented in 1890.
Rain contains vitamin B12
The first toothbrush was invented in 1498.
The average number of readers of any given published scientific paper is said to be 0.6.
Your weight on the moon is 16.5% of your weight on earth.
The elevator was invented in 1850.
The typewriter was invented in 1829.
In the 17th century the value of pi was known to 35 decimal places (today to 1.2411 trillion).
The wristwatch was invented in 1904.
Friends share more DNA than strangers
Scissors were most likely invented ancient Egypt.
Bulletproof vests, fire escapes, windshield wipers, and laser printers were all all invented by women.
Volleyball was invented in 1895.
The dishwasher was invented in 1889.
The doorbell was invented in 1831.
The tea bag was invented in 1908.
A 10-Year-Old Accidentally Created in 2012 a New Molecule in Science Class: Tetranitratoxycarbon
The lie detector was invented in 1921.
The drinking straw was invented in 1886.
There have been serious scientific attempts to study whether or not our "reality" is, in fact, a computer simulation a la "The Matrix.
Humans share 50% of their DNA with bananas.
Due to the new discovery of many brain parasites, scientist now think a Zombie Apocalypse is actually possible.
Scientists finally concluded that the chicken came first, not the egg, because the protein which makes egg shells is only produced by hens.
The "smell of rain" is caused by a bacteria called actinomycetes.
Nikola Tesla once "shook the poop out" of a constipated Mark Twain with an experiment.
Sitting for more than three hours a day can cut two years off a person's life expectancy.
According to a study, up to 50% of the world's natural history specimens in museums are labeled incorrectly.
The electric chair was invented by a dentist.
The revolving door was invented in 1888.
The World's oldest known creature, a mollusc, was 507 years old until scientists killed it by mistake.
The "cheerleader effect", the theory that girls look more attractive in groups, is scientifically proven.
The electric toothbrush was invented in 1939.
There's a hotline filmmakers can call for science advice with the goal of helping filmmakers incorporate accurate science into their films.
There's enough water pressure in one onion cell to cause a steam engine to explode.
The infinity sign is called a lemniscate.
Studies show painting your room blue will make you more creative.
Did you know minus 40°C is exactly the same temperature as minus 40°F?
At 120 miles per hour, a Formula One car generates so much downforce that it can drive upside down on the roof of a tunnel.
A person's ashes can be turned into a diamond.
4.5 pounds of sunlight strike the Earth each day.
If you yelled for 8 years, 7 months and 6 days, you would have produced enough sound energy to heat one cup of coffee.
Did you know the most abundant metal in the Earth's crust is aluminum?
Because of the rotation of the earth, an object can be thrown farther if it is thrown west.

Once in 1945 a computer at Harvard malfunctioned, and Grace Hopper, who was working at this computer, investigated, found a moth in one of the circuits and removed it. Ever since, programmers started calling mistakes in programms "bugs".
The highest temperature produced in a laboratory was 920,000,000 F (511,000,000 C) at the Tokamak Fusion Test Reactor in Princeton, NJ, USA.
Did you know Mercury is the only metal that is liquid at room temperature?
Cellophane is not made of plastic. It is made from a plant fiber, cellulose, which has been shredded and aged.
Did you know sound travels almost 5 times faster underwater than in air?
The rapid rate of expansion of gas is what gives steam its power. One volume of water, at normal atmospheric pressure and at the boiling point, yields 1,670 volume of steam.
The study of insects is called entomology.
James Ramsey invented a steam-driven motorboat in 1784.
Pearls melt in vinegar.
Joseph Priestly is credited with discovering oxygen, ammonia, carbon monoxide, hydrogen chloride, sulphur dioxide, and nitrous oxide.
Sir Isaac Newton was only 23 years old when he discovered the law of universal gravitation.
The chemical formula for Rubidium Bromide is RbBr. It is the only chemical formula known to be a palindrome!
The first man-made insecticide was DDT.
Did you know sound travels 10 times faster through granite than air?
Unbreakable glass was invented in 1903 by the French chemist Edward Benedictus.
41 new species are discovered by scientists every single day.
The word "Scientist" first appeared in 1833.
Scientists alive today outnumber all the scientists who ever lived up to 1980.
The historic news of the first manned flight by the Wright Brothers first appeared in the magazine "Gleanings" in Bee Culture.
Marie Curie is the only person to ever win Nobel prizes in two different areas of science.
Genetic and archaeological evidence suggests there were two distinct dog populations in the world, in the east and one in the west, during the Palaeolithic.
A physicist, faced with a fine for ignoring a stop sign while driving in 2012, proved his innocence by publishing a mathematical paper. He even won a prize his efforts.
Dinosaurs didn't roar. They may have mumbles with their mouths shut, research suggests.
The gene that gives you six fingers is a dominant trait.
A funnel holding a sample of tar pitch sealed in a glass jar shows how some substances that appear solid are actually liquid. It takes 10 years for a single drop to form.
You can swim through syrup just as fast as you can swim through water, even though it is many times thicker.
Continents split up at the same speed finger nails grow.
Naked mole-rats have a high resistance to cancer tumors because they produce an extremely high-molecular-mass hyaluronan and have ribosomes that produce extremely error-free proteins.
Most diamonds on the Earth's surface are between 1 and 3 billion years old.
70% of the time, ice from fast food restaurants was dirtier than toilet water.
A scientist used magnetism to levitate a frog. Magnetic fields lightly distort the orbits of electrons in the frog's atoms.
Scientists have created a functioning guitar the size of a human blood cell.
270 scientists re-ran 100 studies published in the top psychology journals in 2008. Only half the studies could be replicated successfully.
Researchers found that when jazz musicians improvise, their brains turn off areas linked to self-censoring and inhibition, and turn on those that let self-expression flow.
From 2020, all scientific publications on the results of publicly funded research in the European Union will be freely available.
In 2007, scientists in Spain found a tooth from a distant human ancestor that is more than 1 million years old.
Scientists have discovered that monkeys are susceptible to optical illusions, just like humans.
Scientists can locate colonies of Penguins from space just by looking for dark ice patches of penguin poop.
Scientists can identify individual zebras by "scanning" their stripes like a barcode.
Dinosaurs are not, technically, extinct, since birds are considered by science as a type of dinosaur.
In middle school 74% of girl express interest in Science, technology, engineering and math, but when choosing a college major, just 0.4% of high school girls select computer science.
In 2013, two physicist managed to "tie" water into knots.
Scientists have created glow-in-the-dark cats by inserting the jellyfish protein that codes for bioluminescence into their genome.
The "Million Dollar Paranormal Challenge" is offered to anyone who can demonstrate a supernatural ability under agreed-upon scientific testing criteria. In 40 years, no one ever won.
The scientific name of the Llama is "Lama Glama".
Famous science-fiction writer Isaac Asimov died as result of an HIV infection from a blood transfusion given during triple-bypass heart surgery.
A physicist made his cat co-author of his scientific paper to avoid replacing "we" with "I" throughout his paper.
When you donate your body to science, it can get used as a crash test dummy, for medical training, forensic research or to save a life through organ transplants.
29000 rubber ducks were lost at sea in 1992, and are still being found, revolutionising our knowledge of ocean science.
De-extinction is scientifically possible. Several viruses have already been brought back, including the 1918 flu pandemic virus.
The Catholic Church considers the Theory of Evolution to be "virtually certain", and believes that intelligent design "isn't science even though it pretends to be".
Science Nobel Laureates, U.S. Presidents and NASA astronauts were found to be overwhelmingly first-borns.
87% of scientists believe climate change is mostly caused by human activity while only 50% of the public does.
Before Bill Nye became "The Science Guy", he was a stand-up comedian.
Scientists have figured out how to "unboil" an egg.
A worm's mind has been mapped and replicated by scientists into a software that's now inside a Lego robot.
The average speed of Heinz Ketchup squirt is 0.028 MPH.
Gasoline is complex, as it can contain between 150 and 1000 different chemical compounds.
100 000 000 000 solar neutrinos pass through every square centimeter of your body every second.
Viruses can get viruses.
The sun is thought to have completed about 20 orbits during its lifetime and just 1/1250th of an orbit since the origin of humans.
There are about 173 000 venomous species on Earth: from lizards to spiders and fish.
Sound waves can be used to make objects levitate.
Neptune was the first planet to get its existence predicted by calculation before it was actually seen by a telescope.
The average volume of farts a person generates per day ranges around 476 to 1491ml.
Each foot contains about 250 000 sweat glands.
The earth's deepest known point equals 24.5 Empire State Buildings end to end.
Potatoes have more chromosomes than humans.
Parasitic and host plants have a dialogue by sharing genetic information with one another.
Tomatoes have more genes than humans.
Bees can be trained to detect bombs.
There is more CO2 (carbon dioxide) in the atmosphere today than at any point in the last 800 000 years.
Most dinosaurs are known from just a single tooth or bone.
Ice melting in Antarctica has caused a small shift in the region.
There are 10 times more bacterial cell in your body than body cells.
The Big Bang Theory was actually first theorized by a Catholic priest.
Researchers believe the first human case of HIV was in Kinshasa, Congo, around 1920.
You can start a fire with ice.
Every time a woodpecker's hits a tree, its head is subjected to 1000 times the force of gravity.
If you could fold a piece of paper 50 times, its thickness would exceed the distance from here to the Sun.
It would take light 100 000 years to travel from one end of the Milky Way galaxy to the other.
Sunflowers can be used to clean up radioactive waste.
During photosynthesis, plants emit light, called fluorescence, that humans can't see.
Hot water can freeze faster than cold water, in some circumstances.
It only takes 6 minutes for brain cells to react to alcohol.
Eating salmon helps hair grow faster.
Earthquakes turn water into gold. Gold forms from mineral-rich water during earthquakes
Four Japanese scientists measured the amount of friction between a shoe, a banana skin and the floor: it's 0.07 N
Scientists have developed a micro particle filled with oxygen that can be injected into the blood stream, so we can live without breathing.
Scientists can turn peanut butter into diamonds.
Scientists have developed a way of charging mobile phones using urine.
A new scientific method called 'toxineering' turns venoms into painkillers.
Ganglioneuralgia" is the scientific term from brain freeze. Usually when eating ice cream.
Female sharks have thicker skins than males because males have this odd tendency to bite females while mating.
Look at the back of your hand and extend your thumb. Formed triangle was called "anatomical snuff box," because people used to have the habit of sniffing tobacco from here.
Residents of ancient Pompeii could go upstairs to pee.
The cockroaches hiss when surprised, when challenging other cockroaches to a fight and when trying to attract mates.
Out of use a Tersorium (In antiquity in the place of toilet paper) set in a bucket of salt water or vinegar water.
The Central American salamander Bolitoglossa dofleini can extend its tongue more than half its body length in 7 milliseconds, 50 times faster than you can blink an eye.
Hottest Spot on Earth. On Sept. 13, 1922, the mercury soared to 136 degrees Fahrenheit (57.8 Celsius) in El Azizia, Libya.
Breast milk alone can have up to 700 species of bacteria, according to a study released in January 2013.
The male platypus has a venomous spur on its hind foot capable of dispensing a poison that can kill a medium-sized dog.

The Catholic Church once put a dead Pope on trial. After Pope Formosus died in A.D. 896, his successor had him disinterred, dressed in papal robes and set up to face a laundry list of political charges.
Prosopagnosia is a disorder in which people struggle to recognize faces. Faces are so important that humans have a brain area called the fusiform gyrus that specializes in recognizing them.
Mantis shrimp can use their armored claws to strike at speed of 74 feet per second (23 m/s), delivering blows with 200 pounds (91 kg) of force behind them.
